componentDescription: Displays temporary, dismissible messages to inform users about actions, status, or events.

id.description: An optional unique identifier for the toast.

variant.description: The visual style or type of the toast (e.g., success, error, info).

title.description: The main title text displayed in the toast.

description.description: An optional detailed description or message for the toast.

onClose.description: A callback function triggered when the toast is closed or dismissed.

isClosable.description: Determines if the toast can be manually closed by the user.

action.description: An optional callback function for an action button within the toast.

actionText.description: The text to display on the optional action button.

showIcon.description: Controls the visibility of the default icon associated with the toast variant.

theme.description: An optional theme to apply to the toast, overriding the global theme.

views.description: Optional custom styles to apply to different parts of the toast component.

duration.description: The time in milliseconds before the toast automatically closes. Default is usually 5000ms.

render.description: An optional render prop to provide a custom JSX element for the toast content, receiving `id` and `onClose`.

icon.description: An optional custom React node to use as the toast's icon, overriding the default.

isVisible.description: Controls the visibility state of the toast component.

position.description: The position on the screen where the toast container will be displayed (e.g., 'top-right', 'bottom-left').

gap.description: The spacing in pixels between multiple toasts within the container.

limit.description: The maximum number of toasts that can be displayed simultaneously in the container.

containerStyle.description: Optional custom CSS properties to apply directly to the toast container element.
